semantic: Defines parameters for a search index that influence semantic capabilities.
configurations: The semantic configurations for the index.
defaultConfiguration: Name of the default semantic configuration. When set, you don’t need to pass it on each query.
name: The name of the semantic configuration.
prioritizedFields: Defines which fields are used for semantic ranking, captions, highlights, and answers. At least one of title, content, or keywords must be set.
rankingOrder: Specifies which semantic scoring value is used when ordering results.
titleField: Field used as the document title for semantic. Leave blank if you don’t have a title field.
prioritizedContentFields: Content fields used for semantic ranking/captions/answers. Earlier fields have higher priority.
prioritizedKeywordsFields: Keyword fields used for semantic ranking/highlights. Earlier fields have higher priority.
fieldName: The name of the field in the index.
